  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Cashier",
  "description": "Isaacworthub LLC - Our client, a&nbsp;fragrance home, is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier
Job Location:&nbsp;Idimu - Egbeda, Lagos

Job Summary


	We are looking for a&nbsp;friendly, detail-oriented Cashier&nbsp;to join our fragrance home and deliver a warm, seamless in-store experience.


Key Responsibilities


	Process customer purchases accurately and efficiently
	Handle cash, POS, and card transactions
	Provide courteous and professional customer service
	Maintain a clean and welcoming checkout area
	Support basic inventory and store operations


Requirements


	Previous cashier or retail experience preferred
	Pleasant communication and customer service skills
	Attention to detail and integrity with cash handling
	Interest in fragrance, beauty, or luxury retail is a plus.


What We Offer


	Supportive and stylish work environment
	Competitive pay
	Opportunity to grow within the brand


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;jowlimited@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Cashier Job at Isaacworthub LLC




        
    

        
        Isaacworthub LLC - Our client, a fragrance home, is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier
Job Location: Idimu - Egbeda, Lagos

Job Summary


	We are looking for a friendly, detail-oriented Cashier to join our fragrance home and deliver a warm, seamless in-store experience.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Process customer purchases accurately and efficiently
	Handle cash, POS, and card transactions
	Provide courteous and professional customer service
	Maintain a clean and welcoming checkout area
	Support basic inventory and store operations


Requirements


	Previous cashier or retail experience preferred
	Pleasant communication and customer service skills
	Attention to detail and integrity with cash handling
	Interest in fragrance, beauty, or luxury retail is a plus.


What We Offer


	Supportive and stylish work environment
	Competitive pay
	Opportunity to grow within the brand


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jowlimited@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "HR Lead",
  "description": "Isaacworthub LLC, a recruitment Services company, is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Lead
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Role Summary


	The Human Resources Lead will be responsible for leading the organisation&rsquo;s people strategy by driving effective recruitment, engagement, performance, learning, and compliance practices.
	This role will partner with leadership to build a high-performing, engaged workforce while ensuring strong HR governance and employer brand positioning.


Key Responsibilities
Recruitment &amp; Talent Acquisition:


	Lead end-to-end recruitment processes across all roles and levels.
	Develop talent acquisition strategies aligned with business goals.
	Build and maintain strong talent pipelines.
	Ensure fair, inclusive, and efficient hiring practices.


Employee Engagement &amp; Retention:


	Design and implement employee engagement initiatives.
	Develop retention strategies to reduce attrition and improve morale.
	Manage performance management systems and employee feedback processes.
	Support employee wellbeing, culture, and workplace satisfaction.


Training &amp; Development:


	Identify skills gaps and develop learning and development programmes.
	Implement onboarding and continuous learning initiatives.
	Support leadership development and succession planning.
	Track training effectiveness and ROI.


Communication &amp; Interpersonal Effectiveness:


	Serve as a trusted advisor to employees and management.
	Manage internal communication related to HR policies and initiatives.
	Facilitate clear, transparent, and effective people communication.
	Handle employee relations matters professionally and confidentially.


Employer Branding:


	Develop and execute employer branding strategies to attract top talent.
	Strengthen the organisation&rsquo;s reputation as an employer of choice.
	Collaborate with Marketing/Brand teams on talent-related messaging.


Compliance &amp; Risk Management:


	Ensure compliance with labour laws, employment regulations, and industry standards.
	Develop and maintain HR policies and procedures.
	Identify people-related risks and implement mitigation strategies.
	Manage audits, documentation, and regulatory requirements.


Industry Knowledge &amp; Business Alignment:


	Maintain strong understanding of industry trends and workforce dynamics.
	Align HR practices with business strategy and operational needs.
	Support organisational growth, change management, and workforce planning.


Digital Literacy &amp; HR Technology:


	Utilise HRIS and digital tools to manage HR operations efficiently.
	Leverage data and analytics to inform people decisions.
	Support digital transformation of HR processes.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.
	Professional HR certification (CIPM, SHRM, CIPD, HRCI) is an advantage.
	4-6 years&rsquo; experience.
	Experience in [agency / experiential / Media corporate] environments is a must.


Required Skills &amp; Competencies
Core HR &amp; Professional Skills:


	Strong knowledge of HR best practices and employment law.
	Experience across recruitment, engagement, L&amp;D, and HR operations.
	Employer branding and talent marketing experience.
	Strong digital and HR systems literacy.


Soft Skills:


	Adaptability &amp; Flexibility: Thrives in fast-paced, evolving environments.
	Problem-Solving &amp; Conflict Resolution: Handles complex people issues calmly and fairly.
	Strategic Thinking: Aligns people strategy with long-term business goals.
	Collaboration &amp; Teamwork: Works effectively across departments.
	Emotional Intelligence: Demonstrates empathy, discretion, and strong interpersonal awareness.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover note to:&nbsp;isaacworthhub@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",
  "datePosted": "2026-01-03",
  "validThrough": "2026-02-04",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Isaacworthub LLC"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",

      "@type": "PostalAddress",

    }

}



HR Lead Job at Isaacworthub LLC




        
    

        
        Isaacworthub LLC, a recruitment Services company, is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Lead
Job Location: Lagos

Role Summary


	The Human Resources Lead will be responsible for leading the organisation’s people strategy by driving effective recruitment, engagement, performance, learning, and compliance practices.
	This role will partner with leadership to build a high-performing, engaged workforce while ensuring strong HR governance and employer brand positioning.


Key Responsibilities
Recruitment & Talent Acquisition:
     

            
    




	Lead end-to-end recruitment processes across all roles and levels.
	Develop talent acquisition strategies aligned with business goals.
	Build and maintain strong talent pipelines.
	Ensure fair, inclusive, and efficient hiring practices.


Employee Engagement & Retention:


	Design and implement employee engagement initiatives.
	Develop retention strategies to reduce attrition and improve morale.
	Manage performance management systems and employee feedback processes.
	Support employee wellbeing, culture, and workplace satisfaction.


Training & Development:


	Identify skills gaps and develop learning and development programmes.
	Implement onboarding and continuous learning initiatives.
	Support leadership development and succession planning.
	Track training effectiveness and ROI.


Communication & Interpersonal Effectiveness:


	Serve as a trusted advisor to employees and management.
	Manage internal communication related to HR policies and initiatives.
	Facilitate clear, transparent, and effective people communication.
	Handle employee relations matters professionally and confidentially.


Employer Branding:


	Develop and execute employer branding strategies to attract top talent.
	Strengthen the organisation’s reputation as an employer of choice.
	Collaborate with Marketing/Brand teams on talent-related messaging.


Compliance & Risk Management:


	Ensure compliance with labour laws, employment regulations, and industry standards.
	Develop and maintain HR policies and procedures.
	Identify people-related risks and implement mitigation strategies.
	Manage audits, documentation, and regulatory requirements.


Industry Knowledge & Business Alignment:


	Maintain strong understanding of industry trends and workforce dynamics.
	Align HR practices with business strategy and operational needs.
	Support organisational growth, change management, and workforce planning.


Digital Literacy & HR Technology:


	Utilise HRIS and digital tools to manage HR operations efficiently.
	Leverage data and analytics to inform people decisions.
	Support digital transformation of HR processes.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.
	Professional HR certification (CIPM, SHRM, CIPD, HRCI) is an advantage.
	4-6 years’ experience.
	Experience in [agency / experiential / Media corporate] environments is a must.


Required Skills & Competencies
Core HR & Professional Skills:


	Strong knowledge of HR best practices and employment law.
	Experience across recruitment, engagement, L&D, and HR operations.
	Employer branding and talent marketing experience.
	Strong digital and HR systems literacy.


Soft Skills:


	Adaptability & Flexibility: Thrives in fast-paced, evolving environments.
	Problem-Solving & Conflict Resolution: Handles complex people issues calmly and fairly.
	Strategic Thinking: Aligns people strategy with long-term business goals.
	Collaboration & Teamwork: Works effectively across departments.
	Emotional Intelligence: Demonstrates empathy, discretion, and strong interpersonal awareness.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover note to: isaacworthhub@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Pharmacist",
  "description": "Zael consulting is basically a recruitment firm. We offer clients and candidates the confidence of specialist recruiters the have the depth and breath of experience across key sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Pharmacist

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "HMO / Billing Officer",
  "description": "Zael consulting is basically a recruitment firm. We offer clients and candidates the confidence of specialist recruiters the have the depth and breath of experience across key sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HMO / Billing Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented HMO/Billing Officer to manage patient billing, process HMO claims, and ensure accurate documentation and timely reconciliation of payments.


Key Responsibilities


	Generate and manage patient bills (HMO, cash, and corporate)
	Process HMO claims, pre-authorizations, and follow-ups
	Liaise with HMOs to resolve billing and payment issues
	Ensure accurate coding and documentation of services rendered
	Reconcile bills, payments, and outstanding balances
	Work closely with front desk, medical records, and clinical teams
	Maintain confidentiality and accurate billing records.


Requirements &amp; Qualifications


	OND / HND / BSc in Accounting, Business Administration, or related field
	Minimum 2-4 years of experience in hospital billing or HMO processing
	Good knowledge of HMO operations and claims management
	Proficiency in hospital billing systems and Microsoft Excel
	Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.


Salary
N150,000 - N250,000 monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their application to:&nbsp;&nbsp; info@zaelconsulting.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

HMO / Billing Officer Job at Zael Business Management & Consulting




        
    

        
        Zael consulting is basically a recruitment firm. We offer clients and candidates the confidence of specialist recruiters the have the depth and breath of experience across key sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HMO / Billing Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented HMO/Billing Officer to manage patient billing, process HMO claims, and ensure accurate documentation and timely reconciliation of payments.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Generate and manage patient bills (HMO, cash, and corporate)
	Process HMO claims, pre-authorizations, and follow-ups
	Liaise with HMOs to resolve billing and payment issues
	Ensure accurate coding and documentation of services rendered
	Reconcile bills, payments, and outstanding balances
	Work closely with front desk, medical records, and clinical teams
	Maintain confidentiality and accurate billing records.


Requirements & Qualifications


	OND / HND / BSc in Accounting, Business Administration, or related field
	Minimum 2-4 years of experience in hospital billing or HMO processing
	Good knowledge of HMO operations and claims management
	Proficiency in hospital billing systems and Microsoft Excel
	Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.


Salary
N150,000 - N250,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their application to:   info@zaelconsulting.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Human Resources Manager",
  "description": "Aspom Travel Agency was founded on the 2nd of February, 2012 and has remained at the top of its game providing visa assistants, hotels, holiday packages, tours and flight deals to her clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Agungi - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Managing Director / Chief Executive Officer

Job Summary


	The Human Resources Manager will be responsible for overseeing all HR functions, including recruitment, employee relations, performance management, training and development, compensation and benefits, and compliance with labor laws.
	The ideal candidate will play a key role in shaping organizational culture, improving employee engagement, and ensuring that HR strategies align with business objectives.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic &amp; Administrative Duties:


	Develop, implement, and review HR policies, procedures, and systems in line with company goals.
	Advise management on HR best practices, workforce planning, and organizational development.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records and HR documentation.


Recruitment &amp; Talent Management:


	Manage the full recruitment cycle: job postings, screening, interviewing, selection, and onboarding.
	Identify staffing needs and develop recruitment strategies to attract top talent.
	Coordinate employee induction and orientation programs.


Employee Relations &amp; Performance Management:


	Foster a positive work environment and handle employee relations matters professionally and confidentially.
	Oversee performance appraisal systems and support managers in performance improvement plans.
	Address grievances, disciplinary matters, and conflict resolution in line with company policy.


Training &amp; Development:


	Identify training needs and organize learning and development programs.
	Support employee career development and succession planning initiatives.


Compensation, Benefits &amp; Compliance:


	Manage payroll processes, employee benefits, and compensation structures.
	Ensure compliance with labor laws, employment regulations, and internal policies.
	Prepare HR reports and analytics for management review.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements
Education:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Industrial Relations, or a related field.
	A Master&rsquo;s degree or professional HR certification (CIPM, SHRM, HRCI, or equivalent) is an added advantage.


Experience:


	
	Minimum of 3&ndash;5 years of proven experience in Human Resources, with at least 3 years in a managerial role.
	


Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of labor laws and HR best practices.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	High level of integrity, confidentiality, and professionalism.
	Strong organizational and problem-solving abilities.
	Proficiency in HR software and Microsoft Office tools.


What We Offer


	Salary: N250,000 - N500,000 / Month&nbsp;and benefits package
	Opportunities for professional growth and career advancement
	Supportive and collaborative work environment
	Opportunity to contribute to strategic decision-making
",

  "validThrough": "2026-01-23",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

Human Resources Manager Job at Aspom Travel Agency




        
    

        
        Aspom Travel Agency was founded on the 2nd of February, 2012 and has remained at the top of its game providing visa assistants, hotels, holiday packages, tours and flight deals to her clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Manager

Job Location: Lekki, Agungi - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Managing Director / Chief Executive Officer

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Human Resources Manager will be responsible for overseeing all HR functions, including recruitment, employee relations, performance management, training and development, compensation and benefits, and compliance with labor laws.
	The ideal candidate will play a key role in shaping organizational culture, improving employee engagement, and ensuring that HR strategies align with business objectives.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic & Administrative Duties:


	Develop, implement, and review HR policies, procedures, and systems in line with company goals.
	Advise management on HR best practices, workforce planning, and organizational development.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records and HR documentation.


Recruitment & Talent Management:


	Manage the full recruitment cycle: job postings, screening, interviewing, selection, and onboarding.
	Identify staffing needs and develop recruitment strategies to attract top talent.
	Coordinate employee induction and orientation programs.


Employee Relations & Performance Management:


	Foster a positive work environment and handle employee relations matters professionally and confidentially.
	Oversee performance appraisal systems and support managers in performance improvement plans.
	Address grievances, disciplinary matters, and conflict resolution in line with company policy.


Training & Development:


	Identify training needs and organize learning and development programs.
	Support employee career development and succession planning initiatives.


Compensation, Benefits & Compliance:


	Manage payroll processes, employee benefits, and compensation structures.
	Ensure compliance with labor laws, employment regulations, and internal policies.
	Prepare HR reports and analytics for management review.


Qualifications & Requirements
Education:


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Industrial Relations, or a related field.
	A Master’s degree or professional HR certification (CIPM, SHRM, HRCI, or equivalent) is an added advantage.


Experience:


	
	Minimum of 3–5 years of proven experience in Human Resources, with at least 3 years in a managerial role.
	


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of labor laws and HR best practices.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	High level of integrity, confidentiality, and professionalism.
	Strong organizational and problem-solving abilities.
	Proficiency in HR software and Microsoft Office tools.


What We Offer


	Salary: N250,000 - N500,000 / Month and benefits package
	Opportunities for professional growth and career advancement
	Supportive and collaborative work environment
	Opportunity to contribute to strategic decision-making
    

    

        Click here to Apply
